reviews.text: Heard about this place few months ago but we didn‚Äôt have the chance to visit it until a couple of weeks ago that I went with my two years old girl, she loved the playing area and the toys, that were quite clean and in very good condition. I was impressed with the toilets, in one of them you can find all you need to change your baby, changing mat, wipes, nappies and even a toilet seat for those who are potty trained like my daughter. Food was fine, could improve though and include more gluten free options, but can‚Äôt complain. I wish they open until a little later than 3:30 though specially in winter, other than that, loved it, great space to have a coffee whilst watching the kids play. Highly recommended

My 1.5 years old son and me loved here. Breakfast was delicious and loved coffee tasty. Play area is very clean and in good observation position. Especially I gave 5 stars for toilet. Because you can find everything to change baby nappy.  I highly recommend hereüëçüèª My little advice that breakfast menu can improve but not compulsory‚ò∫Ô∏è

What an amazing concept- coffee & play. I visited today for the first time with my two young sons. I had heard about this place when I lived locally, but never got to visit. Today I was desperate for a coffee after attending an appointment close by so I thought I would pay a visit. Natasha, the owner, was personable and welcoming, almost like speaking with an old friend.  To my delight I had missed the ‚Äòmorning rush‚Äô so it was nice and quiet. Honestly, why are there not more establishments like this? My sons played away happily whilst I was able to sit and drink a coffee without being bothered once. It just wouldn‚Äôt have happened if I had gone to a standard coffee shop. In fact, I wouldn‚Äôt have bothered. The prices are no more than high street coffee chains and anyway, can you really put a price on drinking a cup of coffee in peace? Your business is a blessing!

What a strange experience. I just ordered ‚Äòfruit skewers‚Äô for my 4 year old that cost ¬£3.50. I received 2.5 grapes and 3 small strawberries (see photo) I complained and was told that was the portion and it couldn‚Äôt be changed unless I emailed the manager. I think even The Ivy would struggle to charge 30p for half a grape, let alone a local business in Winchmore Hill serving food to children who's parents don‚Äôt want to be ripped off. If it wasn‚Äôt for the seemly embarrassed friendly waitress who was passing on the message from ‚Äòabove‚Äô I would have given even less stars. Myself and my friends who are all families in the area couldn‚Äôt believe the response.  Absolutely revolting behaviour to charge so much for such a small amount of food even with ‚Äòoverhead charges‚Äô it‚Äôs beyond me how these people think it‚Äôs acceptable and then ask to be emailed. Total joke.

What an excellent place! My granddaughterattends the 'After-School' club here. When I go I sit and have a cup of tea and watch children enjoying themselves. The staff are kind and caring. The children love the activities. The play area is clean and well- resouced. The children are collected after school. Once they arrive they  are provided with lovely snacks and then a  tea. A dream for working parents and a treat for visiting grandparents!

address: 832 Green Lanes, London N21 2RT, United Kingdom
